categories-0.3: Category LibraryContentsIndex
Control.Category.Functor.Composition
Portabilitynon-portable (class-associated types)
Stabilityexperimental
MaintainerEdward Kmett <ekmett@gmail.com>
Description
Generalized functor composition.
Synopsis
newtype Comp f g a = Comp (f (g a))
class Category e => HasFunctorComposition e where
comp :: e (f (g a)) (Comp f g a)
decomp :: e (Comp f g a) (f (g a))
newtype Bitransform p f g a = Bitransform (p (f a) (g a))
class Bifunctor p k1 k2 k3 => HasBitransform p k1 k2 k3 | p k1 -> k2 k3, p k2 -> k1 k3, p k3 -> k1 k2 where
bitransform :: k3 (p (f a) (g a)) (Bitransform p f g a)
unbitransform :: k3 (Bitransform p f g a) (p (f a) (g a))
Documentation
newtype Comp f g a
Constructors
Comp (f (g a))
class Category e => HasFunctorComposition e where
Categories don't always give us a way to deal with the newtype labels. This hack witnesses the isomorphism.
Methods
comp :: e (f (g a)) (Comp f g a)
decomp :: e (Comp f g a) (f (g a))
Instances
HasFunctorComposition (->)
HasFunctorComposition k => HasFunctorComposition (Dual k)
newtype Bitransform p f g a
Bitransform transforms a pair of functors using a bifunctor as a functor transformer and boxes it up for typeclass purposes. HasBitransform witnesses this isomorphism.
Constructors
Bitransform (p (f a) (g a))
class Bifunctor p k1 k2 k3 => HasBitransform p k1 k2 k3 | p k1 -> k2 k3, p k2 -> k1 k3, p k3 -> k1 k2 where
Methods
bitransform :: k3 (p (f a) (g a)) (Bitransform p f g a)
unbitransform :: k3 (Bitransform p f g a) (p (f a) (g a))
Instances
Bifunctor p (->) (->) (->) => HasBitransform p (->) (->) (->)
HasBitransform p c d e => HasBitransform p (Dual c) (Dual d) (Dual e)
